step1.text: It's just past midnight as you step into the last subway train. The platform behind you empties into silence. The doors slide shut, and the train pulls away.

step2.text: The car hums with a few scattered passengers. Fluorescent lights flicker overhead. You glance at your phone... no signal. The next stop never comes.

step3.text: The train passes by the station without stopping. You walk to the next car, but the door is jammed. A woman at the end of your car suddenly vanishes.

choices.text: Break the glass and move ahead
Sit quietly, hoping things fix themselves
choices.outcome: You're swallowed by the seat as if the train itself claims you.

step4.text: You break through to the next car. A teenager stares at you and whispers, "They come when it's quiet." He hands you a strange token before vanishing.

choices.text: Take the token and keep moving
Drop the token and return to your seat
choices.outcome: You dissolve mid-step, your body becoming dust in the stale air. You're gone.

step5.text: Alone now, you pass through three cars each emptier than the last. The speakers crackle before announcing a station you've never heard of.

choices.text: Wait for the train to stop itself
choices.outcome: The train slows just enough for shadowy arms to pull you into the tracks below.

step6.text: You pull the emergency brake. The train screeches, but doesn't stop - instead, the windows go pitch black. A distorted reflection of yourself moves its hand to shake hands with you.

choices.text: Smash the window and jump outside

choices.outcome: Your hand is pulled in, followed by your body, leaving only a smear on the glass.

step7.text: You jump through the broken window into the dark tunnel, landing hard on concrete. The train vanishes behind you, soundless. A red glow flickers deeper in the tunnel.

choices.text: Stay put and wait for help
choices.outcome: The darkness thickens, and unseen footsteps circle before dragging you away screaming.

step8.text: The red glow leads you to a forgotten platform, crumbling and overgrown. A scratched sign reads "NO RETURN." You hear a distant announcement - in your own voice.

choices.outcome: The ladder twists mid-climb, folding you into the wall like wet paper.

step9.text: The voice leads you to a mirror image of the train - same model, same car, but empty and still. A door opens with a hiss, inviting you in.

choices.text: Turn and run the other way
choices.outcome: A faceless conductor appears behind you, lifts you effortlessly, and snaps your neck in silence.

step10.text: Inside the mirrored train, everything is reversed - signs, seats, even your watch ticks backward. A child sits alone, whispering, "Come and sit with me."

choices.outcome: Each step forward ages you rapidly, until your bones give out with a final crack.

step11.text: The child points to a flickering door at the back of the mirrored train and says, "Your stop is coming... but only if you can guess my name."

choices.outcome: The child grows into a monster and rips you apart.

step12.text: You emerge onto a platform lit by a single, swinging bulb. A payphone rings - loud, mechanical, urgent - though there's no cable attached.

choices.outcome: Each ignored ring slows your heartbeat until it stops completely.

step13.text: The voice on the phone says, "Move towards the gate. Don't turn around, no matter what you hear." Behind you, footsteps echo and a wet breathing grows louder asking "Do you need help?"

choices.text: Turn around and ask for help
choices.outcome: Your eyes meet a blank, skinless face - and your body falls limp before you can scream.

step14.text: Ahead, an elevator door opens with a ding. Inside: mirrors on all sides, and a single button labeled "-13."

choices.text: Step out and run down the tunnel
choices.outcome: The tunnel floor gives way, and you're swallowed by oily black water.

step15.text: The elevator drops - endlessly. The mirrors show versions of you panicking, crying, bleeding... but only one stares calmly back and moves its hand ahead to shake hands.

choices.text: Close your eyes until it stops
choices.outcome: When you open them, you're in a padded metro car forever looping nowhere.

step16.text: The elevator stops immediately. The doors open to a decaying station with two telephones on the wall. One red and the other Green. Which one are you picking?

choices.outcome: The ink bleeds into your skin, and you vanish screaming into the headlines.

step17.text: On the red phone, you hear "wait for me". A shadowy conductor appears, his lantern flickering with whispers. "You're not on the schedule," he growls, "but maybe you can earn your stop."

choices.text: Offer him the token that child gave you
choices.outcome: He stamps your chest with a rusted ticket puncher - your heartbeat ends on the last click.

step18.text: He laughs and says "I don't need your hollow soul" and leads you to a train car with two mannequins wearing your clothes, posed in scenes from your memories. He says "Sit next to one of one of these". Which?

choices.outcome: It turns to you and whispers, "I hate children." Then bites your body off.

step19.text: The mannequin stops the train. The lights cut out. In total darkness, you hear a recorded announcement loop: "Mind the gap between memory and self. Mind the gap..."

choices.outcome: The announcement grows into a scream that bursts your eardrums, then your skull.

step20.text: Light returns. You're on a platform labeled "Death." One train waits. Its destination sign flickers: "You."

choices.text: Turn and run back into the station
choices.outcome: The platform extends endlessly behind you and something follows, just out of sight.

step21.text: Inside the train, every window shows different versions of your life - in some, you're rich; in others, dead. One window is blacked out.

choices.text: Look into the windows for clues

choices.outcome: The glass shatters into hands that drag you screaming into static.

step22.text: A voice on the intercom says, "Choose your stop wisely. You only get one." The list of destinations scrolls endlessly until it lands on two: "Home" and "Truth."

choices.outcome: You arrive at your doorstep where your body hangs from the ceiling fan, still twitching.

step23.text: The train screeches to a halt. You're alone. The doors open to a staircase leading upward, inscribed with names - all yours, in dozens of languages.

choices.text: Jump off the platform to escape
choices.outcome: You land in a void where lost passengers float, mouthing silent screams forever.

step24.text: At the top, a room full of mirrors awaits. Each reflection is slightly wrong - some smile when you don't, others blink out of sync.

choices.text: Smash the mirror that doesn't mimic you
Choose the smiling reflection to follow
choices.outcome: It steps out and replaces you, leaving your soul trapped inside the glass.

step25.text: You enter a final hallway. At the end, a door labeled "EXIT" pulses with light. Behind you, footsteps multiply - fast, heavy, and inhuman.

choices.text: Turn to face what's chasing you
choices.outcome: The footsteps stop. A hand grabs your face. Your scream becomes the next train's horn.

step26.text: You burst through the EXIT door - only to find yourself back on the metro, but this time, it's frozen. Everyone aboard is a wax figure... except one slowly turning its head toward you.

choices.text: Pretend to be a wax figure too
Run past the figure to the next coach
choices.outcome: It lunges, melting into a screaming mass that consumes you whole.

step27.text: The train begins to move again, but now the carriages are numbered backwards: 13, 12, 11... counting down. You're in Coach 6. The countdown is accelerating.

choices.text: Jump off at Coach 1 before the countdown hits zero
Stay put, hoping it's all a trick
choices.outcome: The timer hits 0, and the train folds in on itself like paper, taking you with it.

step28.text: Coach 1 is empty but lit by red emergency lights. In the center: a single control lever and a note that reads, "Pull only if you remember your name."

choices.text: Pull the lever while chanting your full name
Pull the lever without saying anything
choices.outcome: The train resets, and you're born again as a crying infant on the ghost train.

step29.text: The train halts beside a mirror-still underground lake. A ferry with a veiled figure beckons. "One last fare," it whispers.

choices.text: Refuse and run along the tracks
choices.outcome: The tunnel collapses into water, and something pulls you under, whispering your regrets forever.

step30.text: You awaken on the street above the station - it's dawn. The metro entrance is sealed, overgrown with vines. In your hand: a metro ticket stamped "USED."

end_with_restart_from_3.text: The End. Would you like to try again?

end.text: The End. Would you like to play again?
